result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May serve probation in Kenosha County.

miscConds.notes: Determined to be $397.63 due AG plus 10% surcharge due the Clerk of Cirucity Court.  Bond to apply.
Statutory court costs assessed.  Bond to apply.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. This may include cognitive intervention. 
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Remain in compliance with restraining order.
No contact of any kind with the victim AG.  
Defendant has been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan M Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
